Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: The user works on several documents, emails, and applications in sequence. This pattern suggests a single-case work session where tasks are interconnected as part of an overall report preparation process.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Based on the continuous timeline without significant gaps, it is inferred that all the events are part of the same overarching task rather than distinct cases.

Name: Inductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Events like 'FOCUS', 'TYPING', 'SAVE', and 'SWITCH' for different applications align with a logical multi-step work process, supporting the idea of grouping events under one case.

Name: Heuristic Reasoning - PE
Text: Applying the heuristic that a user switching between related applications (e.g., Word, Chrome, Acrobat) immediately after save or switch actions indicates continuity of intention within a case.

Name: Abductive Reasoning - IND
Text: Assuming each document, email, and application interaction represents interconnected steps in completing a single complex task, though there's a possibility that they are separate cases.

Name: Validation - PE
Text: Using the expert example as validation, grouping all events into a single case aligns with their approach of treating the session as one report preparation process.

Name: Hypothesis Generation - IND
Text: Considering the hypothesis that each app/window focus represents a separate task (case) but deeming it less likely due to temporal and contextual continuity.
